reviewText: As a resident of Buffalo, I find Wright's contributions to the architectural legacy of our great city one of our greatest assets. To learn the story behind these works, I turned to this wonderful WNED/PBS program.

A great look at a little remembered period of Wright's history. With the fabulous restoration of the Martin House complex in Buffalo, more people than ever will want to know about this period. This is a very well produced program.
It should really have been entitled Wright and Darwin Martin. Davidson and Heath became incidentals. The university connection with the Martin house was also skimmed over.
I was leery of ordering a used DVD on line, but was quite satisfied with the product, both content and performance.

a high quality professionally done program with interviews and still shots of the inside of the long lost larkin office building.  narrated by david ogden stiers .  although already a few years old it is a welcome addition to my library.
